result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D. Schober was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No objection to discharge after 6 months if Agent feels appropriate and terms of Probation are complete.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.

Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Brandon D. Schober in court with attorney Wesley Kottke.  
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered. 
Court questions defendant and advises of rights. 
Court accepts plea and finds guilty. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 12 months probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees  
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- not assosciate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician 
- obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions 
- no objection to discharge after 6 months if Agent feels appropriate and terms of probation are complete
